  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date()
      A constructor that creates a Date object with today's date.

    • Date

      public Date(String date)
      A constructor that creates a Date object given a String.
      Parameters:
      date - : a String that contains a date in mm/dd/yyyy format.

  • Method Details

    • getMonthNumber

      private int getMonthNumber(String monthName)
      A helper method that converts an abbreviated month name into its corresponding numerical value.
      Parameters:
      monthName - : a String containing an abbreviated name of a month.
      Returns:
      the corresponding numerical value for the given month.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      A method to check if the current Date object represents a valid date. In order for a date to be valid, the year must be equal to the current year. The day must be a valid day within the corresponding month, taking leap years into account. The date also cannot be after the current date.
      Returns:
      true if the Date object satisfies the above criteria, false otherwise.

    • validNumDays

      private boolean validNumDays()
      A helper method to check if the day field is valid for the current Date object (i.e. checks if the day is lower or higher than possible for the corresponding month).
      Returns:
      true if the day is valid, false otherwise.

    • isLeapYear

      private static boolean isLeapYear(int year)
      A helper method that checks if a given year is a leap year or not.
      Parameters:
      year - : a year expressed as an integer.
      Returns:
      true if the year is a leap year, false otherwise.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date date)
      A method that compares two dates to each other.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      date - : the Date object that you are comparing to the current Date object.
      Returns:
      0 if the two dates are the same, -1 if the current Date object is earlier than the date argument, and 1 if the current Date object is later than the date argument.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Represents a Date object as a String. Executes when a Date object is printed to the screen.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a String that represents the date in mm/dd/yyyy format.
